intro: Hesperis provincialis, commonly known as the Provincial Hesperis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it blooms during the late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
